data.text: @zerocovidzoe @kategard2021 @Saffiya_Khan1 @chrischirp Not sure what that has to do with the point under discussion.  Re-infections are included in the daily figures since Jan 31. Whether the figures are accurate for other reasons is a different topic.
@martinswadley @chrischirp @BlanshardC You are obviously not keeping up to date, part of the ‘pretend it’s gone away’ group.

@LuffNeil @chrischirp What strategy is that? Stop looking and you won’t find it strategy, or pretend it has gone away strategy, or concentrate people’s minds on something else so they won’t notice how many people are still getting it strategy?
@LeeInCornwall @chrischirp You need to get a life
@Nbishara @RemainRevoke @chrischirp Cases are starting to rise in England again
@Nbishara @RemainRevoke @chrischirp I think very very few people mostly the old need this vaccination. But what they really need is a good vaccination
@Nbishara @RemainRevoke @chrischirp Yes I think it’s better that the majority of people Stay unvaccinated

@The_Ouroboros__ @SallyJiggles @sxb66 @macronencer @kategard2021 @Saffiya_Khan1 @chrischirp But they're not. The death rates are significantly below a usual year! Unless there's been a massive drop in deaths due to cancer/ heart disease/ strokes/ etc (which there isn't) - it's impossible to pretend people are dying ** of ** covid, rather they're dying ** with ** covid.

@SallyJiggles @The_Ouroboros__ @sxb66 @macronencer @kategard2021 @Saffiya_Khan1 @chrischirp Simple statistics Sally. If significant numbers were dying because of covid - the total death numbers would not be significantly below a normal year.

Do you think with all the missed health checkups in the last 2 years that cancer, heart disease, etc will be lower than usual?
